title: WhatsApp to stop working without SIM: Govt's new rule; 90 days to comply

This initiative is designed to thwart cyber fraud by ensuring that apps do not operate on deactivated SIMs. Additionally, web versions will automatically log users out after six hours.

title: ‘You must leave the country now’: Trump delivers blunt ultimatum to Maduro on call
description: President Trump issued an ultimatum to Venezuela's Nicolás Maduro, offering safe passage in exchange for immediate departure. Maduro reportedly refused, demanding global amnesty and control of the armed forces, leading to collapsed talks. Trump acknowledged speaking with Maduro but offered no details, later warning of Venezuelan airspace closure amid escalating US military presence and accusations of fueling a drug crisis.

title: 'Why talk about Kohli's future?': India coach shuts down noise; hints at 2027 WC plans
description: India's batting coach Sitanshu Kotak firmly dismissed speculation surrounding Virat Kohli's ODI future, emphasising his current form, fitness, and crucial contributions. Kotak stated that discussions about the 2027 World Cup are premature, as the team focuses on present performance. He highlighted Kohli's recent century as proof of his continued value, assuring that the veteran remains central to India's plans.

title: Oxford word of the year: It's ‘rage bait’ — here's what it means
description: Oxford University Press has declared 'rage bait' the Word of the Year 2025, citing a threefold surge in online usage. This term describes content intentionally crafted to provoke anger and boost engagement.  Its selection highlights a significant shift in how online attention, interaction, and ethics are perceived and manipulated in the digital sphere.

Minelli, who established Dignitas in 1998, dedicated his final years to exploring new avenues for end-of-life choices. The organization will continue his legacy, upholding principles of self-determination and freedom of choice.

title: Scared of losing money? How to start investing even when you are afraid - explained
description: Many fear investing due to market volatility and potential losses. However, data shows long-term equity investments typically reward patience, while inaction risks losing purchasing power to inflation. Protecting yourself with an emergency fund and insurance, then starting small with a diversified fund, helps manage fear and build wealth over time through consistent, disciplined behaviour.

PM2.5 and PM10 levels are also at their lowest since 2018.  Revised GRAP guidelines now place stricter measures under Stage III, impacting office operations.  However, allegations of data manipulation and lax enforcement have surfaced.

description: Winter exacerbates autoimmune symptoms due to declining Vitamin D, disrupted melatonin, increased viral infections, and dietary/lifestyle changes. Can a cold shower really spike your blood pressure?
description: Cold showers can cause a sudden rise in blood pressure. This happens due to blood vessel tightening and stress hormone release. People with heart conditions face higher risks. However, the body might adapt over time to regular cold exposure. A cautious approach is advised. Gradual temperature reduction and consulting a doctor are recommended for safety.

title: Trump to release MRI results, but he doesn’t know which body part was scanned – watch
description: US President Donald Trump stated he is willing to release the results of an October MRI scan, describing them as "perfect." The White House has not clarified the purpose or body part scanned, only confirming it was part of a routine physical.

title: '1983 Nellie killings not communal': Assam makes Tewary report public; 41 years after submission
description: A 41-year-old report by the Tribhuvan Prasad Tewary Commission, recently made public by the Assam government, reveals that successive administrations allowed the state's "land and identity crisis" to worsen. The report, which investigated the 1983 Nellie massacre, identified illegal immigration and land disputes as key drivers of violence, not just communal clashes.

title: 'Payment for betrayal': Man stabs wife over extramarital affair; posts selfie with body
description: A 32-year-old man murdered his estranged wife at a women's hostel in Coimbatore, stabbing her to death over an alleged extramarital affair. He then took a selfie with her body and posted it on WhatsApp with a vengeful message. The accused has been arrested by the Rathinapuri police.

title: Shifting visa pattern: H-1B nod for IT firms drops to 4.5k - lowest in a decade
description: Top Indian IT firms saw a significant 70% drop in H-1B initial employment approvals for FY 2025. Tech giants like Amazon and Meta now dominate new H-1B approvals, signaling a major shift in the visa landscape. This trend suggests a focus on retaining existing employees rather than bringing in new talent.

title: FM to move bill today for new cess on tobacco, pan masala
description: The government plans to introduce a new cess on tobacco and pan masala products. This move aims to prevent price drops after the GST compensation cess is phased out, ensuring these 'sin goods' remain costly. The proposed health and security cess will be implemented once notified, potentially before the compensation cess expires in March 2026.

description: Leon Draisaitl responded with 'Lol' to criticism about Edmonton Oilers' leadership.  The podcast suggested top players like Draisaitl and Connor McDavid should provide more direction.  Despite past Stanley Cup Final appearances, the Oilers face defensive struggles this season.  Their offense remains strong with McDavid and Draisaitl.  Fans are divided on the criticism.  The team's on-ice performance will ultimately show leadership.

title: Hyderabad scam: Telecallers to mimic Australian accent pull off Rs 10cr fraud; ex-students recruited
description: Cyberabad police busted a fake call center where telecallers mimicked Australian accents to scam citizens. The operation, which siphoned crores over two years, involved recruiting individuals familiar with Australia to gain victims' trust and banking details. The kingpins remain at large.

title: ‘Want father, brothers to be hanged’: Teen 'marries' boyfriend’s corpse
description: A 18-year-old woman in Nanded accused her father and brothers of murdering her 25-year-old Buddhist boyfriend due to their inter-caste relationship. She performed symbolic wedding rituals before his funeral and demanded capital punishment for the accused. Police have arrested the family members and others involved in the brutal killing.

title: South Mumbai college files complaint against guest speaker for inappropriate behaviour with students
description: St. Xavier's College has lodged a complaint with Azad Maidan police after a guest speaker allegedly photographed female students without consent and made inappropriate physical contact during a national conference. The college's Internal Complaints Committee received complaints from at least 10 students.

title: Gmail storage hack: How to keep inbox running smoothly - Check details
description: Running out of Gmail storage? Don't panic! This guide reveals how to quickly free up space by clearing trash, deleting large attachments, and managing newsletters. Learn to use Google's Storage Manager to declutter across Drive and Photos, ensuring smooth performance and avoiding costly upgrades. Maintain a clean inbox with simple, regular habits.

title: Thousands of Amazon employees send open letter to CEO; question layoffs
description: Over a thousand Amazon employees have penned an open letter, warning that the company's rapid AI development is jeopardizing its climate commitments and human workforce.  They argue the pursuit of AI dominance is leading to increased emissions, water scarcity, and job displacement, urging leadership to prioritize ethical AI and environmental responsibility.
